headline.main: As Parents, Are Fathers the Second Sex?

docs.abstract: He feels like an equal parent at home - so why do doctors and day care workers insist on talking to his wife?
docs.snippet: He feels like an equal parent at home - so why do doctors and day care workers insist on talking to his wife?

headline.main: When Is a Bad Mother a Criminal?

docs.abstract: In Alabama, women who use drugs while pregnant can face years in prison. Wise policy or the "pregnancy police" run wild?
docs.snippet: In Alabama, women who use drugs while pregnant can face years in prison. Wise policy or the "pregnancy police" run wild?

docs.abstract: Do economic and societal pressures influence women's career choices without our registering their impact?
docs.snippet: Do economic and societal pressures influence women's career choices without our registering their impact?

docs.lead_paragraph: The Nebraska Legislature has sent the message that promoting healthy pregnancies is more important than fretting over a woman’s immigration status.
docs.abstract: Editorial praises the Nebraska Legislature for overriding Gov Dave Heineman's veto of a bill to provide free prenatal care to undocumented immigrant women; notes that result was brought about by an unlikely alliance between women's health advocates and anti-abortion groups who feel that unborn children do not yet have an immigration status.
docs.snippet: The Nebraska Legislature has sent the message that promoting healthy pregnancies is more important than fretting over a woman’s immigration status.

docs.lead_paragraph: The family minivan idles at the intersection of 59th and York in Midtown Manhattan. My boyfriend swabs my midriff with alcohol as he steadies the needle. My parents look on from the front seat, quietly studying their 22-year-old daughter and the young man they've known for only a month. The needle is filled with gonadotropin, a hormone that stimulates the ovaries to produce eggs. I'm late for my checkup at the fertility clinic. How in the world did I get here?

headline.main: A Patient for Now, but Maybe a Mother Someday

docs.abstract: Suleika Jaouad essay describes her struggle with infertility, which was caused by chemotherapy she underwent for leukemia; discusses decision to preserve her eggs in advance of the cancer treatment. Photo (M)

headline.main: The Depressing Lot of the Conflicted American Mother

docs.abstract: How "the conflict" between work and motherhood looks when motherhood remains hypothetical.

docs.abstract: In a house where Catholic devotion fell somewhere between that of Mary Tudor and John Paul II, a first date was its own punishment.
